reviews.review_msg: Final exam you were allowed to print your notes out or have your computer with you if it was on airplane mode. only one exam and a few papers. The content in her lectures is laid out a little confusing, making it occasionally hard to follow. She was also my TA and randomly chooses people to participate in tutorials so watch out if you don't like it

This class really made me love my major (int'l studies). Dr Malik's lectures were very engaging and she was good at breaking down concepts. She's a pretty cool person. The readings were usually quite interesting and weren't too heavy. Tutorial participation is a big part of the grade.

Dr. Malik was an extremely kind professor, and you could tell she genuinely cared about her students and wanted them to do well. Lectures can get dry, but she gives multiple breaks. Just attend tutorials and try to participate as much as possible. I did absolutely none of the readings and finished with the easiest A of my life.

Would not recommend the class for an elective. Some of the readings are like 30 pages which is crazy for a first year class. Lectures are sometimes confusing because she adds so much info that isn't talked about in the actual readings. The final is an in-class essay which is quite difficult for a class with so much content.

She assigns a lot of readings, but you can get away with reading the summaries she posts online. Her assignments also have tons of flexibility as to what you can write on, so focus on 2-3 big themes in the course and you'll do fine. GPA booster if you attend all the tutorials and are good at writing.
Final was an in class essay and u had to choose 1 topic from 5. The class was not bad but a lot of readings. 2 written assignments and participation which counts as 20%.

She is a very sweet and kind professor. As for the class, there were only two assignments, one work 20% and the other 25%. Tutorials are mandatory as they count for 20% of the class grade. However i would not recommend the class as the final is a in-class essay worth 35%. The class is so content heavy so having an essay for a final makes no sense

This class was beyond confusing, and beyond difficult. I have NEVER written one of these rate my profs, but I had to for this class as a warning not take IS101. There is WAY to much material each class. No one in this class has an understanding of what is going on.

IS101 with Dr Malik was thoroughly enjoyable. For a 3 hour lecture, Dr Malik was able to read the room well and knew when students were becoming tired, and took breaks/ offered reassurance of breaks during these moments. The material was interesting and eye opening. Make sure you refine your essays and ensure you are answering the essay prompt.
